fields.headline: Round up
fields.bodyText: With more than an eye on their FA Cup semi-final with Liverpool on Sunday, Wycombe slipped to a 2-1 defeat at home to Second Division play-off hopefuls Wigan. Their manager Lawrie Sanchez left the ground in disgust afterwards leaving his assistant Terry Gibson to explain: "Sometimes you can say things in the heat of the moment that you regret so he decided to go home." A hat-trick by Mark Robins put Rotherham three points clear at the top after a 4-3 home win against lowly Swindon, who led twice before Robins wrapped it up six minutes from time. In the First Division, Huddersfield's manager Lou Macari praised his £200,000 signing Andy Booth after he scored the opener in a 4-1 home win over Portsmouth. "Booth caused them lots of problems in the air and was a real threat," he said. The Terriers are two points behind Grimsby, who are above the drop zone but lost 2-1 at Norwich. Lennie Lawrence, Grimsby's manager, conceded: "It will take a massive effort, both physically and mentally, to get out of trouble now, starting next week when we play Tranmere." The Third Division leaders Chesterfield made it three games without a win after being held 1-1 by Southend. David Reeves earned a point with a second-half equaliser. Brighton are eight points behind after a 2-0 win over Mansfield.
